body:
Not overly important, but there are a few Wsign-conversion issues.
Sign conversion issues can possibly cause out of bounds memory issues and poses as a possible security risk, but extremely unlikely. So ignore this if it's not important! :)

1. https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/c7ea3c1b4d8371b92455c76b24b6e819d54e43e7/Cython/Utility/MemoryView_C.c#L601
`sizeof_dtype` is type `size_t`, however `Py_ssize_t` is required. Should be fine since `itemsize <= 0` checks for size_t overflows. So a simple cast can remove this warning.
https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/c7ea3c1b4d8371b92455c76b24b6e819d54e43e7/Cython/Utility/MemoryView.pyx#L138
2. I can't seem to find __Pyx_PyInt_AddObjC in Github, but the error is:
`warning: conversion to 'long int' from 'digit' {aka 'unsigned int'} may change the sign of the result [-Wsign-conversion] 34415 |             a = likely(size) ? digits[0] : 0;`
```
{
        const long b = intval;
        long a, x;
#ifdef HAVE_LONG_LONG
        const PY_LONG_LONG llb = intval;
        PY_LONG_LONG lla, llx;
#endif
        const digit* digits = ((PyLongObject*)op1)->ob_digit;
        const Py_ssize_t size = Py_SIZE(op1);
        if (likely(__Pyx_sst_abs(size) <= 1)) {
>>>>        a = likely(size) ? digits[0] : 0;
            if (size == -1) a = -a;
```
3. Seems like Python's unicodeobject.h also has a conversion issue:
```
C:\Users\Daniel\miniconda3\include/unicodeobject.h:458:36: warning: conversion to 'int' from 'unsigned int' may change the sign of the result [-Wsign-conversion]
#define PyUnicode_KIND(op) \
  457 |     (assert(PyUnicode_Check(op)), \
      |     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  458 |      assert(PyUnicode_IS_READY(op)),            \
      |      ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  459 |      ((PyASCIIObject *)(op))->state.kind)
      |      ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
note: in expansion of macro 'PyUnicode_KIND'
  487 |   #define __Pyx_PyUnicode_KIND(u)         PyUnicode_KIND(u)
```
It looks like `PyASCIIObject`'s kind is a `unsigned int:3` but `PyUnicode_KIND` accepts `int` as the 3rd argument.

[I have more Wsign-conversion issues. I'll update this later!]

Thanks!!!!
Keep up the great work Cython team!
title: [BUG] Wsign-conversion warnings inside Cython codebase
